resource.name: Funded and Licensed Child Care Providers
resource.description:
The following dataset includes programs of different types that are licensed and/or funded. The dataset encompasses data pulled quarterly from EEC’s Licensing Education Analytic Database (LEAD).

Licensed programs are programs that are subject to licensing regulations by EEC, which include meeting health and safety standards, training and professional development requirements, criminal and background checks, and maintaining appropriate ratios of educators to children. Licensed programs can include any of the following: family child care and group and school age programs. For more information on licensed programs click here.

Funded programs are programs that are not subject to licensure by EEC but have the approval from EEC to provide subsidized child care for low-income or at-risk families. Funded programs can include any of the following: public schools; private schools; religious schools; and government, tribal, and military child care programs. For more information on funded providers click here.

The types of programs in this dataset include:

  • Family Child Care is child care provided in someone's home where the caretaker is not related to the children.

  • Group and School Age programs provide early education and care for young children in a non-residential setting such as a school or community center. These programs include several types of early education and care such as: - Center-based care for infants, toddlers, preschool, or kindergarten age children; Early Head Start and Head Start programs; and Out-of-school time programs that operate before/after school or during the summer.

  • Public school programs take place in public school settings and are overseen by the local school district. Public school programs are included here if they enrolled at least one child receiving an EEC subsidy.

  • Private school programs take place in private schools. Private school programs are included here if they enrolled at least one child receiving an EEC subsidy.
resource.attribution: MA Department of Early Education and Care
columns_description: Provider's multi-age group capacity. Not available for data pulled on 7/01/2022 and 10/01/2022

A composite measure, designed by the Center for Disease Control and Prevention, to determine the relative social vulnerability of every census tract.  EEC uses the SVI of the census tract and the zip code in which a provider is located as part of the formula for its Commonwealth Cares for Children (C3) formula. This measure is not available for public schools. Recently licensed programs may not yet have an SVI. For more information on the SVI measure, see the following website: https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/placeandhealth/svi/index.html
The date the data was pulled from EEC’s Licensing Education Analytic Database (LEAD)
Unique Program ID (P-#) from EEC’s Licensing Education Analytic Database (LEAD)

The composite, CDC designed SVI measure described above, but recalculated at the zip code rather than census tract level. This measure is not available for public schools. Recently licensed programs may not yet have an SVI.
Region for the purpose of subsidy administration

The total number of children that a provider can serve at a given time. Capacity by age is not available for Family Child Care providers and Group and School Age providers with a capacity below 10.  Capacity by age may not add up to total capacity because of the overlap of age groups.
Date the program first received license from EEC or was approved to be funded by EEC
Program's status as licensed or funded
Type of Child Care Providers (Family Child Care, Group and School Age, Public School, Private School)
Regional office that oversees program’s licensing

resource.name: Educator Dashboard: Total Educators, Retention, and New Hires
resource.description:
The Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education has committed to provide all students with a racially diverse and culturally responsive educator workforce. This dataset displays state and district level educator data by race and ethnicity for each district, with rows for different years, different educator groups, and a wide range of indicators.
Total Educators: This displays the annual number and percent of distinct educators who self-reported/identified as the selected Race/Ethnicity as of the first weekday in October of each school year. Data are further disaggregated by job classification group.
Educator Retention: This displays the number and percent of educators who were working in the same position from one school year to the next (via consecutive October EPIMS collections).
New Hires: This displays the annual number and percent of new hires in the selected Race/Ethnicities. It counts teachers who were reported as "working" in the annual October EPIMS collection who were hired on or after June 1 of the prior school year.
This dataset contains the same data that is also published in the Total Educators, Educator Retention, and New Hires tables on our Educator Dashboard.
resource.attribution: Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

resource.name: Next Generation MCAS Achievement Results
resource.description: The Massachusetts Comprehensive Assessment System (MCAS) is a statewide assessment administered to help parents, students, educators, and policymakers determine where districts, schools, and students are meeting expectations and where they need additional support. This dataset contains Next Generation MCAS results by school since 2017, including achievement level, participation rate, average scaled score, and average student growth percentile. Please note that Legacy MCAS results are not included in this dataset, nor are PARCC or other student assessment results. A table documenting the transition to Next Generation MCAS over time can be found in the DESE Researcher's Guide linked as featured content below. Student growth percentile (AVG_SGP) was calculated as a median for 2017. In 2018 and onward, it is a mean. For more information about MCAS data, click here. This dataset contains the same data that is also published on our DESE Profiles site: Next Generation MCAS Achievement Results
resource.attribution: Department of Elementary and Secondary Education
columns_description: Number of Students Included in SGP Calculation

resource.name: Staffing: Race/Ethnicity and Gender
resource.description:
This dataset contains the full time equivalent (FTE) count and percentage of educational staff by race/ethnicity and gender employed in all Massachusetts public and charter schools and districts since 2008. The information is as of October 1st of the school year reported. In certain years, a small number of schools or districts have failed to meet data reporting requirements. Since 2023, FTE counts and percentages for those schools and districts are reported here as null, and on Profiles as "Failed to meet data reporting requirements." Prior to 2023, these schools and districts were reported here and on Profiles as either null or 0. This dataset contains the same data that is also published on our DESE Profiles site: Staffing Data by Race/Ethnicity and Gender List of Job Classifications Administrators

resource.name: Educator Dashboard: Licensure
resource.description:
The Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education has committed to provide all students with a racially diverse and culturally responsive educator workforce. This dataset displays educator licensure data by race and ethnicity with rows for different years.
Educator Licensure: This displays the number and percent of individuals who were issued an emergency, provisional, and initial license within the school year (September 1 to August 31).
This dataset contains the same data that is also published in the Educator Licensure table on our Educator Dashboard.
resource.attribution: Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

resource.name: Educator Dashboard: MTEL
resource.description:
The Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education has committed to provide all students with a racially diverse and culturally responsive educator workforce. This dataset displays MTEL (Massachusetts Tests for Educator Licensure) data for each test subject by race and ethnicity with rows for different years.
MTEL Pass Rates: This displays the number of candidates (i.e., test takers) who took the Massachusetts Tests for Educator Licensure and the percent who passed during the program year.
This dataset contains the same data that is also published in the MTEL Pass Rate table on our Educator Dashboard.
resource.attribution: Department of Elementary and Secondary Education
columns_description: Test Takers with Passing Score Percent

resource.name: Pre-Kindergarten and Kindergarten Enrollment
resource.description: This dataset contains pre-kindergarten and kindergarten enrollment data for all Massachusetts public and charter schools and districts since 2017. Both the number and percent of pre-kindergarten and full-day kindergarten students are reported by student group. The number of part-time, tuitioned, and full-time kindergarten students are also reported by the same student groups. Economically Disadvantaged was used 2015-2021. Low Income was used prior to 2015, and has been used again since 2022. Please see the DESE Researcher's Guide for more information. This dataset contains the same data that is also published on our DESE Profiles site: Enrollment by Pre-Kindergarten Enrollment by Kindergarten
resource.attribution: Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

resource.name: Educator Dashboard: Educator Preparation
resource.description:
The Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education has committed to provide all students with a racially diverse and culturally responsive educator workforce. This dataset displays educator preparation data by race and ethnicity with rows for different years.
Educator Preparation: This displays the number and percent of candidates who enrolled and completed their program in the program year. This is based on the individuals' furthest, or most recently reported, point in the selected program year as reported by the organization.
This dataset contains the same data that is also published in the Educator Preparation table on our Educator Dashboard.
resource.attribution: Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

resource.name: Enrollment: Grade, Race/Ethnicity, Gender, and Selected Populations
resource.description:
This dataset contains student enrollment data for all Massachusetts public and charter schools and districts since 1994. It is a wide file with three groups of columns representing the following enrollment indicators:
  • Number of students by grade, including pre-kindergarten (PK), kindergarten (K) and special education beyond grade 12 (SP)
  • Percent of students by race and gender
  • Number and percent of students in student groups: First Language Not English, English Learners, Students with Disabilities, High Needs, Low Income, and Economically Disadvantaged
Economically Disadvantaged was used 2015-2021. Low Income was used prior to 2015, and has been used again since 2022. Please see the DESE Researcher's Guide for more information. This dataset contains the same data that is also published on our DESE Profiles site: Enrollment by Grade Enrollment by Race/Gender Enrollment by Selected Population
resource.attribution: Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

resource.name: Wage Dashboard: College and Career Outcomes
resource.description: This dataset provides the number of graduates who enrolled in each type of postsecondary education by district. Wage records are obtained from the MA Department of Unemployment Assistance (DUA) using a secure, anonymized matching process with limitations. Approximately 85-90% of students in each Graduation Year were found in the wage record system which does NOT include employment outside of Massachusetts, federal employment, or self-employment. DUA does not collect information regarding hours worked, hourly rate, or Standard Occupational Classification (specific job type). Postsecondary enrollment information is obtained from the National Student Clearinghouse (NSC). Institutions reporting enrollment information covers approximately 97% of college students nationwide. NOTE: "Number Employed" refers to the total number of students found in wage records, and NOT found in postsecondary enrollment records. Suppression: Average earnings are not reported for counts of fewer than 6. Suppression is applied under the following conditions: - If the HS Graduate Count of the student group is less than 6. - If the Employment Count of a student group during any Earnings Year is less than 6. - If the Employment Count of a student group is 1 during any Earnings Year, that student group and the student group with the next lowest Employment Count within that student group category is suppressed. - Suppressed values are displayed as blanks. - Totals are based on calendar years for which a full year of wage data are available. This dataset also contains the same data that is also published in the Employment and Earnings of High School Graduates dashboard: Wage Dashboard

resource.name: Wage Dashboard: Average Annual Earnings by Industry
resource.description: This dataset provides the average annual earnings by industry per district. Wage records are obtained from the MA Department of Unemployment Assistance (DUA) using a secure, anonymized matching process with limitations. Approximately 85-90% of students in each Graduation Year were found in the wage record system which does NOT include employment outside of Massachusetts, federal employment, or self-employment. DUA does not collect information regarding hours worked, hourly rate, or Standard Occupational Classification (specific job type). Postsecondary enrollment information is obtained from the National Student Clearinghouse (NSC). Institutions reporting enrollment information covers approximately 97% of college students nationwide. NOTE: "Number Employed" refers to the total number of students found in wage records, and NOT found in postsecondary enrollment records. Suppression: Average earnings are not reported for counts of fewer than 6. Suppression is applied under the following conditions: - If the HS Graduate Count of the student group is less than 6. - If the Employment Count of a student group during any Earnings Year is less than 6. - If the Employment Count of a student group is 1 during any Earnings Year, that student group and the student group with the next lowest Employment Count within that student group category is suppressed. - Suppressed values are displayed as blanks. - Totals are based on calendar years for which a full year of wage data are available. This dataset also contains the same data that is also published in the Employment and Earnings of High School Graduates dashboard: Wage Dashboard
